author: E. Marcel Pourtout mpourtout@neighbornewspapers.com (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Klinnert delivers on volleyball court
text: Klinnert delivers on volleyball court by E. Marcel Pourtout October 21, 2015 02:10 PM | 246 views | 0 | slideshow The Cambridge volleyball team has won 29 contests, a region championship and its first-round state playoff contest this season through the contributions of outside hitter Ellah Klinnert. The sophomore is second on the team with 233 kills, 26 blocks and 15 aces.In the Bears’ 3-1 home win in the finals of the Area 7 tournament on Oct. 10, Klinnert had 17 kills and seven blocks. Against Union Grove in the first-round of the state playoffs on Oct. 15, she had 10 kills. This season Klinnert has amasses seven or more kills in 17 contests this season, reaching double-digits in six of them. Defensively, she has recorded at least one block in all but four matches. Klinnert was named to the All-Area team this season as well.“Ellah has played a big role in our wins,” Cambridge coach Katie Johnson said. “She’s allowed us to have more options with our front row for offense. Ellah’s been instrumental to our success this season and I’m looking forward to seeing her improve.”Klinnert moved to Milton from Minneapolis, Minn., this summer and been an immediate contributor for the Bears. “I came in with a positive attitude and tried to bring everyone together,” she said. “I bring an athletic dynamic to the team from the outside position. I couldn’t have done this without my team.”Klinnert found an immediate home with Cambridge team. “The girls were welcoming which was huge for me,” she said. “I’ve made a good connection with all of them. I like this area and its been fun moving down here”Off the court, Klinnert lists veterinarian science and agriculture as her favorite class subjects at the school. She plans to pursue a career working with animals in an outdoor capacity.The Bears return to action for the second round of the playoffs in a home contest against South Effingham on Tuesday, Oct. 20 starting at 6 p.m.
